t: Proverbs 5
The Peril of Adultery
My*pn son, pay attention to my wisdom; Lend*ld your ear to my understanding,
That*ld you may preserve discretion, And*ld your lips may keep knowledge.
For*ld the lips of an immoral woman drip honey, And*ld her mouth is*i smoother than oil;
But*ld in the end she is bitter as wormwood, Sharp*ld as a two-edged sword.
Her*ld feet go down to death, Her*ld steps lay hold of hell.
Lest*ld you ponder her*i path of life— Her*ld ways are unstable; You*ld do not know them.*i
Therefore*ln hear me now, my*i children, And*ld do not depart from the words of my mouth.
Remove*ld your way far from her, And*ld do not go near the door of her house,
Lest*ld you give your honor to others, And*ld your years to the cruel one;*i
Lest*ld aliens be filled with your wealth, And*ld your labors go*i to the house of a foreigner;
And*ld you mourn at last, When*ld your flesh and your body are consumed,
And*ld say: “How*ld I have hated instruction, And*ld my heart despised correction!
I*ld have not obeyed the voice of my teachers, Nor*ld inclined my ear to those who instructed me!
I*ld was on the verge of total ruin, In*ld the midst of the assembly and congregation.”
Drink*ln water from your own cistern, And*ld running water from your own well.
Should*ld your fountains be dispersed abroad, Streams*ld of water in the streets?
Let*ld them be only your own, And*ld not for strangers with you.
Let*ld your fountain be blessed, And*ld rejoice with the wife of your youth.
As*ild a*i loving deer and a graceful doe, Let*ld her breasts satisfy you at all times; And*ld always be enraptured with her love.
For*ld why should you, my son, be enraptured by an immoral woman, And*ld be embraced in the arms of a seductress?
For*ln the ways of man are*i before the eyes of the Lord,*s And*ld He ponders all his paths.
His*ld own iniquities entrap the wicked man,*i And*ld he is caught in the cords of his sin.
He*ld shall die for lack of instruction, And*ld in the greatness of his folly he shall go astray.
